title: Connection (algebraic framework)
summary: Geometry of quantum systems (e.g., noncommutative geometry and supergeometry) is mainly phrased in algebraic terms of modules and algebras. Connections on modules are generalization of a linear connection on a smooth vector bundle E → X {\displaystyle E\to X} written as a Koszul connection on the C ∞ ( X ) {\displaystyle C^{\infty }(X)} -module of sections of E → X {\displaystyle E\to X} .[1]
